snippet.title: Movie Review:Star Wars:The Clone Wars
snippet.description: The Force isn't as strong as in previous 'Star Wars' flicks, but light-saber wielding kids -- from padawan 5-year-olds to Jedi-entrenched tweens -- will want to see it over and over again

snippet.title: Book Review: Soldier's Heart: Being the Story of the Enlistment and Due ...
Calling a Truce on Lunchbox Wars -- Tips to Make the Most of Daily Nutrition
snippet.description: Paula Chase-Hyman Packing a healthy lunch for your kids might be easy for you, but it might be a struggle for you to get them to eat it! Writer Paula Chase-Hyman offers some tips to end the lunchbox wars!

snippet.title: The Impact of War on Children
snippet.description: Ways To Help Soothe Your Children During Wartime

snippet.title: Video Game Review: Star Wars Episode III: Revenge of the Sith
snippet.description: Lacks the Force of other Star Wars games.

snippet.title: Book Review: The Day of the Pelican
snippet.description: Harrowing fictionalization of the war in Kosovo.

snippet.title: DVD Review: The War of the Worlds (1953)
snippet.description: Some grisly and scary parts. Not for young 'uns.

snippet.title: Movie Review:Journey to the Center of the Earth (2008)
snippet.description: Spend the extra dough to treat the kids to the 3-D version of Journey. Bonus: They can keep the cool shades.

snippet.title: Review: War of the Worlds
snippet.description: Alien invasion thriller too scary for young kids.

snippet.title: Movie Review:Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest
snippet.description: Fate has Captain Jack Sparrow on the run. Davy Jones, lord of the undersea dead, has unleashed his Kraken (sea monster) to square Jack's broken promise to serve 100 years on Jones' ship, The Flying Dutchman. Meanwhile, ...
